metadata.Title: CVE-2020-36312 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.8.10. virt/kvm/kvm_main.c has a kvm_io_bus_unregister_dev memory leak upon a kmalloc failure, aka CID-f65886606c2d.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36312` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1082-aws - 4.4.0-1082.86
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1100-azure - 4.15.0-1100.111~14.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1082.86').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1100.111~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-197.229~14.04.1').
